com.xilinx.rapidwright.design.tools

Class LUTTools

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.design.tools.LUTTools

  • public class LUTTools
extends Object
    A collection of tools to help modify LUTs.

      • isCellALUT

        public static boolean isCellALUT(Cell c)
        Checks if this cell is a LUT (LUT1, LUT2, LUT3,...). A CFGLUT5 will return false.
        Parameters:
        c - The cell in question
        Returns:
        True if this is a LUT[1-6], false otherwise.

      • isCellALUT

        public static boolean isCellALUT(EDIFCellInst i)
        Checks if this cell is a LUT (LUT1, LUT2, LUT3,...). A CFGLUT5 will return false.
        Parameters:
        c - The cell in question
        Returns:
        True if this is a LUT[1-6], false otherwise.

      • getLUTSize

        public static int getLUTSize(Cell c)
        If the provided cell is a LUT, it will return the LUT input count. If it is not a LUT, it will return 0.
        Parameters:
        c - The LUT cell
        Returns:
        The number of LUT inputs or 0 if cell is not a LUT.

      • getLUTSize

        public static int getLUTSize(EDIFCellInst c)
        If the provided cell instance is a LUT, it will return the LUT input count. If it is not a LUT, it will return 0.
        Parameters:
        c - The LUT cell
        Returns:
        The number of LUT inputs or 0 if cell is not a LUT.

      • initLength

        public static int initLength(String init)
        Extracts the length value from the INIT String (16, in 16'hA8A2)
        Parameters:
        init - The init string.
        Returns:
        The init length.

      • getLUTSize

        public static int getLUTSize(String init)
        Performs essentially a log_2 operation on the init string length to get the LUT size.
        Parameters:
        init - The LUT's init string.
        Returns:
        Size of the LUT by number of inputs (1-6).

      • printTruthTable

        public static void printTruthTable(Cell c)
        Prints out the truth table for the given INIT string on the cell. If the cell is not a LUT, it prints nothing.
        Parameters:
        c - The Cell in question.

      • printTruthTable

        public static void printTruthTable(EDIFCellInst c)
        Prints out the truth table for the given INIT string on the cell. If the cell is not a LUT, it prints nothing.
        Parameters:
        c - The cell instance in question.

        Converts the Verilog-syntax number literal for the LUT initialization to a primitive long integer.
        Parameters:
        init - The LUT INIT string.
        Returns:

      • getLUTInitFromEquation

        public static String getLUTInitFromEquation(String equation,
                                            int lutSize)
        Evaluates the provided equation in order to create the INIT string of a LUT of the given size. Equation syntax: Operators: XOR: @, ^ AND: &, *, . OR: |, + NOT: ~, ! A Few Examples: O = 0 O = 1 O = (I0 & I1) + (I2 & I3) O = I0 & !I1 & !I3 NOTE: XOR and AND have the same precedence and are evaluated from left to right. Vivado uses different rules for handling operators of the same precedence, so be sure to use parentheses to avoid any ambiguity!
        Parameters:
        equation - A Vivado LUT Equation String. This follows the same conventions as the Vivado LUT equation string editor.
        lutSize - LUT size (input count), supported sizes are: 1,2,3,4,5,6
        Returns:
        The INIT string to program the LUT of the provided size

      • configureLUT

        public static EDIFPropertyValue configureLUT(Cell c,
                                             String equation)
        Programs a LUT cell's init string from the provided equation.
        Parameters:
        c - The LUT cell to program.
        equation - The desired programming of the LUT using Vivado LUT equation syntax.
        Returns:
        The previous LUT init string or null if none.

      • configureLUT

        public static EDIFPropertyValue configureLUT(EDIFCellInst c,
                                             String equation)
        Programs a LUT cell's init string from the provided equation.
        Parameters:
        c - The LUT cell instance to program.
        equation - The desired programming of the LUT using Vivado LUT equation syntax.
        Returns:
        The previous LUT init string or null if none.

      • getLUTEquation

        public static String getLUTEquation(Cell c)
        Reads the init string in this LUT and creates an equivalent (non-optimal) equation.
        Parameters:
        c - The LUT instance
        Returns:
        The equation following LUT equation syntax or null if cell is not configured.

      • getLUTEquation

        public static String getLUTEquation(EDIFCellInst i)
        Reads the init string in this LUT and creates an equivalent (non-optimal) equation.
        Parameters:
        i - The LUT instance
        Returns:
        The equation following LUT equation syntax or null if cell is not configured.

      • getLUTEquation

        public static String getLUTEquation(String init)
        Creates a (dumb, non-reduced) boolean logic equation compatible with Vivado's LUT Equation Editor from an INIT string. TODO - Enhance with a logic minimization method such as Quine-McCluskey method.
        Parameters:
        init - The existing INIT string configuring a LUT.
        Returns:
        A Vivado LUT Equation Editor compatible equation.

        public static void main(String[] args)
